text: hello this is Bill Cunningham from New
York and we're in the January blah
period but there was this hope not that
anything is ever gonna replace black but
all during the holiday season and into
January a spark came with these kind of
blanket colors in particular the kind of
Fiesta stripes and colors
oddly enough Louie Vuitton holiday
decorations were stripes on their Fifth
Avenue building and one morning a woman
who was waiting to cross the street and
her coat was chevron stripes so that's
all I had to say they give me a nap it
was just terrific and everywhere I look
I'm seeing bits of it now no one has to
panic nothing is replacing black nothing
but what a cheerful note in January when
you need something you know in these
cold days I thought it was just simply
terrific
and there was even one woman in the
evening with a kind of Mexican fiesta
chevron stripe evening dress and there
is a man that comes along young man in
the art world
and he literally picks the carpet off
the floor and wears it he stitches
together the four ends and puts his arm
through it I couldn't believe it I
thought that that's the real thing we
could wear the carpet right off before
everyone can put fashion down and say it
doesn't mean a thing
but it does because each morning when
you get dressed when you go out it
just lifts your spirits
Oh
